page.title: 05The De Vere House
page.content: The De Vere is in Water Street.It was built in the 1400s.Over the front door you can see the Star and Boar of the De Vere family.The house fell into ruins and was rebuilt in the 1920s.The bricks between the beams are modern and called brick-hogging. There is a large pointed front door, with a smaller door in the middle.The stairs once used to be a chimney.The front bedroom has a sloping floor and large carved beams.There is a blocked window in the sitting-room where another house was built on,for a relation of the De Vere family. A stream runs underneath the front of the house.This stream provided water for washing and there were steps down to the water in the High Street,at the site of the present-day bus shelter.
